name: Morte Region
desc: Who knows how long the story guarded with the tall tower on the sea that the people ignore has been kept?

imgDesc.text: This was once many things and many dreams.

customize.text: Illustrations
"The Steambird Special Edition" Version 4.2

<color=#ffd780>November 5, 2023</color>
Hello, Travelers~ After the Version 4.2 update, "Erinnyes Forest" and "Morte Region" will be available in Fontaine! Check out this Special Edition of The Steambird to learn more about the special features of the new areas~
Resources
Local Specialties

customize.name: Spring of the First Dewdrop
customize.desc: A limpid drop of dew floating amidst the waters of Morte Region. It is different from other pure water bodies, as though it is a conglomeration of even more pure and primordial Elemental Energy.

customize.text: Radiant Spincrystals

customize.text: Map
Location Map
Questioning Melusine and Answering Machine

One day, the symbol of the newspaper The Steambird, Sir Arthur, was kidnapped in the Court of Fontaine. Talochard, an employee of the Marechaussee Phantom, volunteered to investigate the case. She wasn't a detective but an evidence clerk. The Melusine brought the mek "Curve," who could recognize lies, with her. The Traveler and Paimon passing by became interested in what was happening near The Steambird and joined the investigation. Together they collected evidence and found several suspects. Although almost all the suspects turned out to be innocent, their investigation revealed a connection between the kidnapping of Sir Arthur and Curve.

Thirty years ago, a researcher Dr. Mosso Lombroso created a lie detector, the "Curve." He added some rules to the machine's core programming to ensure the accuracy of the lie detection. Those rules named the Mosso Protocols required Curve to answer all questions with complete accuracy and honesty, excluding the possibility of lying. The researcher's true goal was to create a machine that would gradually become human by understanding lies and humanity. If Curve would learn to lie like humans one day, it would mean that he was no longer bound by his machine programming and had acquired human emotions. Not long after the existence of Dr. Mosso's lie detector was made public, The Steambird published several articles on it and quickly drew the people's attention. The paper used special features to incite widespread fear and worry among the general public, and soon, public opinion began to turn against Lombroso. People started to worry about what would happen if a suspect in a trial isn't lying, but Curve says he is; or how to guarantee that the lie detector's output is credible. Finally, The Steambird provided evidence that exposed Dr. Mosso as having falsified results, and this evidence was key to the researcher's conviction. To save his creation, Mosso Lombroso died defending himself in a court duel.

The investigation led Talochard and others to the long-abandoned laboratory of Dr. Mosso. It turned out that the researcher initiated all these incriminating articles himself. He wanted to feed the data from public opinion to the lie detector to study. He thought this lesson on dynamic evolution could surely guide his machine to another level of comprehension, and in separating truth from fiction. Curve would have eventually surpassed a machine's rules. Dr. Mosso even modified the Mosso Protocols hundreds of times. He forged the evidence and gave it to the newspaper, so he would take all the heat. Thirty years later, newspaper editor Jenck learned from the Fatui agent, who was involved in the kidnapping of Sir Arthur, that the newspaper had published false accusations that led to the scientist's death. Jenck had no regrets for the doctor but decided to take advantage of the situation and reveal the truth so that people would sue the newspaper the same way it had sued Dr. Mosso. Then the Editor-in-Chief Euphrasie would have problems, and Jenck could take her place. People would remember him as a fearless fighter for justice who solved such a high-profile case.

Jenck overheard Talochard, the Traveler, and Paimon discussing the laboratory near the editorial doors and followed them to the Morte Region along with the Fatui. Long ago, the editor made a deal with the Fatui agents, led by one of the Harbingers, that he would find them Mosso's research, and in return, they would help him lead The Steambird. In the laboratory, Jenck took possession of instructions for turning on the self-destruction system and, in order to stop the Traveler, turned it on before escaping. They could neither open the doors nor get through the pipeline, otherwise an explosion would have occurred. Curve tried to calculate the probability of saving Talochard, Paimon, and the Traveler, but his calculations did not bring positive results. He then revealed that he could disable the self-destruction system by placing his core in the control room to unlock the security room. He knew that his core was rapidly aging, and he would soon go into hibernation mode, so he decided to trick Talochard into saving her. The self-destruct system could not be turned off, and as soon as Talochard and the others were in the emergency exit, an explosion occurred, and the entire laboratory was flooded. Although Curve died in the explosion, he finally fulfilled his creator's dream and broke the Mosso Protocols. The Fatui are now looking for Curve's remains and the data stolen from Dr. Mosso's laboratory.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Court of Fontaine Region
customize.desc:
"This city alone stands above all waters."

Towering up at the highest point of the city, the Palais Mermonia represents the highest authority in Fontaine. Under its gaze, the people lead orderly lives that are as regular and predictable as the aquabus.

Law serves to maintain a stable order, which is in turn the cornerstone that equity and justice are built upon.

customize.name: Talochard
customize.desc: An evidence clerk in the Marechaussee Phantom.

customize.name: "Curve"
customize.desc: A lie detector created by Dr. Mosso thirty years ago.

customize.text: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo

Ever since Rene de Petrichor created his calculation scheme, called the "world-formula," and compared it with "Fortuna" in the records of the Golden Troupe, his main goal was to oppose by any means the prophecy associated with the destruction of Fontaine. While exploring the ruins of Petrichor, he discovered information about the origin of the Fontainians and their differences from other people (all Fontainians were Oceanids who were turned into people by Egeria, the first Hydro Archon). From the information received, Rene had an idea about a way to avoid the apocalypse by returning to the origin and creating Neohumans. He wanted to use the "Seal of Chymical Marriage," a magical technique left behind by the Golden Troupe, to identify several important locations in Fontaine through which his plan could be carried out.

Ancient Remurians believed that complete mastery over the body by one's will was the consummation of human virtue, a pinnacle that only gods and the rarest of mortals could come close to attaining. Following moral decay, the will became shackled to bodily form, willpower withered, and humanity became entirely enslaved to their flesh. The Remurians reached heights that were challenging to attain in study and differentiation of the spirit. Spirit was divided into memory, wishes, soul, and persona. Among these, the state that came closest to the perfect freedom that divinities possessed was named "True Will." The detachment of human will with such meticulous research as a jumping-off point. Upon learning of this, Rene decided that separating a person's will could be the key to salvation from the prophecy. If the God King Remus created imperishable bodies of stone and bronze for the Remurians, then Rene wanted to create Neohumans and separate the will of the Fontainians in order to wait out the apocalypse and escape fate. At the Narzissenkreuz Institute, Rene discovered the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz, capable of uniting and concentrating the will of many people. Rene hoped to avoid making the same mistakes as the Remurians.

<color=#ffffffd9>"...To excise the self is not to die, but rather to die before death. That way, there is no life to be ended. Thus may one achieve eternity. This step is vital, for by this, may one avoid receiving a Vision by some error. To receive a Vision to sell oneself to the "fate" of this world ‚Äî to Heimarmene, and to evermore lose the chance to walk the correct path."</color>

When the construction of the four Orthants and the Tower of Ipsissimus was almost completed, Rene decided to take risks for the common goal and get rid of the useless human personality by "rediscovering himself" through the water of the Primordial Sea. The rebirth of
did not happen, and only through Jakob's efforts, the part of his personality was managed to be preserved in the Orthant. Jakob had to not only revive his friend but also hide Rene's condition and prevent the collapse of the Ordo. During numerous experiments, he managed to create an intelligent creature that even grew pseudopods, but the creature lasted only 32 days. In the end, he still managed to create a new body for Rene and implant his consciousness there. The cornerstone was a pocket watch that Alain Guillotin gave to Jakob and Rene, as it represented the time when Rene was around. After the revival, Narzissenkreuz did not remember the failure. Jakob believed that Narzissenkreuz would take long strides and walk far ahead of them once more, casting his slender shadow in the sun. He would guide all of them in shaping a new future, one in which there will be a place for everyone.
<color=#ffffffd9>"...All of us Fontainians will be able to transcend in this way, shedding the limitations of physical form and separation, and prevent the apocalypse‚Ä¶"</color>

As the prophecy began to come true, Jakob Ingold decided to forge the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz and reverse the "Seal of Chymical Marriage" to release the Primordial Sea. He hoped that Narzissenkreuz, who had gone under the tower, would break the seal and take possession of the source of life. Only with the help of the Holy Blade would he be able to continue his unfinished work, gathering the wills of everyone in Fontaine, the continent, and even the entire planet unto himself. As the Primordial Sea returns once more, and as
darkens the sky, only he who is whole unto himself may survive. The will of all souls, being spared from destruction, would welcome a new dawn in the tranquil sea of innocence he would them. The Blade of Will would fall into the waters and be grasped by its legitimate owner to gain the power to combat the apocalypse. To prevent spiritual impurities and contaminants from entering the Narzissenkreuz's space, Jakob even performed the "Dispelling Ritual" in the Tower of Gestalt.
After luring the Traveler into the Tower of Gestalt with the material for the Holy Blade, Jakob tried to take away the Persona element but died under the collapsed hand of the Doomsday Clock. Descending into the Primordial Sea under the tower, the Traveler, Paimon, and Ann met Narzissenkreuz, who was awaiting the beginning of the apocalypse. He believed that the Traveler wanted to prevent him from saving the world: <color=#ffffffd9>"Why, why has this happened? Why, why did you do this? The new world cannot be born. All will die in a shell, a husk of a dream!"</color> Narzissenkreuz realized that changes had occurred in the values originally entered into the world formula, since he did not take into account the appearance of the Traveler, the witness of all, in Teyvat. Accepting his mistake and defeat, Narzissenkreuz agreed to leave and reseal the Primordial Sea.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo
customize.desc: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo is the secret society formed by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold to create Neohumans in order to survive against the destruction of the world as foretold by the world-formula. It was declared an illegal extremist group and a criminal organization by Fontainian law under Iudex Neuvillette.

customize.name: Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc: The leader of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, formerly known as Rene de Petrichor.

customize.name: Jakob
customize.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

customize.name: Ann
customize.desc: An Oceanid created by the consciousness of Mary-Ann.

customize.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
customize.desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.

customize.name: Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc:
A holy sword that bears a special meaning in a certain story.

It belongs to no one.

customize.name: Treasure
customize.desc:
An old pocket watch.

It has ceased to tick and tock, and its cover cannot be opened.

customize.name: Unlocked "Treasure"
customize.desc:
An old pocket watch.
It seems to have stopped at a certain instant, the beautiful memory of a moment becoming eternal.

customize.text: East Slopes of Mont Automnequi

<color=#ffffffd9>"Not only do we share the same resilient skin,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>But the same divine essence flows within our veins.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>As there is one wisdom, one melody,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>So too are our wills one.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Comrades,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>We are the hands and legs, the shield and sword,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Roots and leaves, spring and stream.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>We should draw near to each other,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Even unto outlanders must this be so."</color>

The eastern slope is located at the intersection of the Belleau and Morte regions, to the right of the Clementine aquabus line. Like most of the Morte Region, over a thousand years ago these lands belonged to the ancient civilization of Remuria, and about 450 years ago they were used by the forbidden esoteric organization, the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. Some of these places are the sunken ruins and the Orthant of Souls, one of the four points on the map of Fontaine related to the "Seal of Chymical Marriage." The "Seal of Chymical Marriage" is a magical technique of the Golden Troupe, an organization founded by the Harmost Boethius on the remains of the sunken empire of Remuria. The technique consisted of two parts: "Circle of Four Orthants" and "Tree of Emanation." According to the Golden Troupe's records, there were several important places in Fontaine needed to seal off

One of the Remurian Harmosts, Aurelius, divided all phenomena into four categories: Substance, Property, Quality, and Relation. Quality was the keystone, which is what is often called the "Quadrant of Qualities": memories, wishes, soul, and persona. The Four Orthants were named in honor of the four components of Quality. About 450 years ago, all four Orthants were built by the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. Even before the founding of the order, their leader, Rene de Petrichor, discovered the records of the Golden Troupe. He learned about "Fortuna" and that kingdoms rise and fall, and when a civilization is annihilated, a new one will be born after from the ashes. This phenomenon turned out to be similar to Rene's computational scheme, called the "world-formula." After countless calculations, he found a discrepancy with Fortuna: unlike the world depicted in these ancient texts, there will be no more new civilizations born. Like the ancient Remurians, Rene wanted to escape fate and avoid the promised Apocalypse, so he founded the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. Rene was greatly influenced by the views of the Harmost Aurelius and the emphasis on Quality as the main category of all things.

Ann, Caterpillar, Seymour, Traveler, and Paimon went to the Orthant of Souls one day. Ann was an Oceanid searching for the truth about her origins; Caterpillar ‚Äî a former member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo; Seymour was a mechanical sentient dog created by the great scientist, Alain Guillotin, looking for his sister and the Marechaussee Hunter, Mary-Ann Guillotin. A riddle guarded the entrance to the Orthant:
<color=#ffffffd9>"Lo, this place is the Orthant of Souls, the Shrine of Souls, the Room of Souls..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"I accompany you in eternal rest"... "Born in an instant, often contradicting, always united"... "I am life's most cherished treasure"...</color>
These lines were from a centuries-old classic novel. It reads, <color=#ffffffd9>"I was born in the fleeting moment when eyes meet. I run with my back turned to the one I pursue. Even after all flesh, bone, and entrails have been sliced away, I still lie nestled with you in the marrow that remains."</color> The answer to the riddle was "love."

In the Orthants, the Traveler and the others sought materials to create the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz. The Ordo was able to reproduce the four requisite hypothetical substances here in the material world, based on the esoteric philosophies of the underground kingdom and ancient Fontaine. These enigmatic substances were purely experiential, perhaps even more elusive than elemental power. And thus, four types of substance came into being: Memory, Wish, Soul, and Persona. In the Narzissenkreuz Ordo's brand of mystical philosophy, the Holy Blade was "reason," that which cuts everything open. It could only be born out of consummate human will. This knowledge of the order was also gleaned from the records of the Remurian Harmosts. They wanted to create an object endowed with meaning, the essence of which would be determined only by Quality. One of these items was a sword forged in memory of the Harmost Euergetia, and for the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, it was the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz. The Ordo used this sword to sever the people's will. Just like the Remurians separated their melody in order to escape the prisons of rotting flesh and gain eternal and independent life, the Narzissenkreuz Ordo wanted to get rid of the shackles of the physical body through the separation of the will.

The Traveler wanted to use the Holy Blade to cut through the barrier built by Ann's creator, another Oceanid, Mary-Ann. She was a fusion of the personalities of Mary-Ann Guillotin, Seymour's mistress, and the Oceanid Lyris, a member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. Mary-Ann was born approximately 450 years ago when the Marechaussee Hunters engaged in battle with members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, among whom were Caterpillar and Lyris. Mary-Ann Guillotin was injured in the explosion and was on the verge of death, but Lyris merged their consciousnesses, creating Mary-Ann. Ann and the others wanted to separate the personalities of Mary-Ann Guillotin and Lyris using the Holy Blade of Reason.
Another member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, Jakob Ingold, who remained faithful to the ideals of the order, also wanted to forge the same sword. He needed it to complete the main goal of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo in the Tower of Ipsissimus. It was he who got ahead of the Traveler and took the Soul element from the Orthant.

Inside the Orthant of Souls, a mysterious looking glass is located, a portal leading to subspace inside the Book of Revelations. The world inside the book was created by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold. It was a reminder of what the world would look like after the apocalypse Rene calculated. In such a world, even sweet flowers and mint would not grow. For the first time, the Traveler and Paimon entered the world inside the book through the Book of Revelations itself, hidden inside the body of the petrified creature, Elynas. One of the Melusines tried to decipher this book, and for her, the subspace seemed like a beautiful garden. When the Traveler passed through all six mirrors, the world inside the book changed for the Melusine as well.

On the north of the Eastern slope of Mont Automnequi, a sunken tombstone of Sigewinne's teacher, the head nurse of the Fortress of Meropide, is located. Many years ago, she became the only one who was ready to teach medicine to a Melusine. The children called this traveling doctor "the witch," and the witch taught Sigewinne how to make all kinds of potions and the art of using ghost stories to scare children into taking medicine. One day, Sigewienne, the Melusine she taught, became friends with a girl, but when she fell ill, her parents forbade the Melusine from coming to cure her, because they did not trust the species, which was different from them. Sometime before that, the "witch" discovered a strange illness that manifested itself in the dissolution of the human body (this "illness" was explained by the origin of the Fontainians from the Oceanids, so the water of the Primordial Sea returned them to their origin). Even after using herself as an experimental subject, she was stumped and could not find an answer on how to cure this illness, but she made a discovery: by mixing this liquid with some specific ingredients, she received a face-changing solution usable by Fontainians alone.

The woman considered this discovery meaningless until Sigewinne told her about her human friend. Then the teacher realized that Melusines could also use this potion. The key component of the potion was the fluid left behind by dissolved Fontainians. Sacrificing herself, the teacher made a potion for Sigewinne and disappeared without saying goodbye. Although the Melusine did not know about her teacher's research, she accepted her parting gift and created a new appearance for herself, more similar to a human. Only many years later, when Fontaine's prophecy about the dissolution of people came true, Sigewinne opened the sealed letter from the "witch" and learned the whole truth, that the woman sacrificed herself to help the Melusine. In this place, Sigewinne dispelled the last existing bottle of the face-altering potion.
In this subarea, the World Quest

can be found.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Oceanids
customize.desc: Oceanids are intelligent Hydro lifeforms created by the previous Hydro Archon, Egeria, and are able to manipulate water at will. All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo
customize.desc: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo is the secret society formed by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold to create Neohumans in order to survive against the destruction of the world as foretold by the world-formula. It was declared an illegal extremist group and a criminal organization by Fontainian law under Iudex Neuvillette.

customize.name: Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc: The leader of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, formerly known as Rene de Petrichor.

customize.name: Jakob
customize.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

customize.name: Caterpillar
customize.desc: A member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo given the title "Chrysalis of the Phantasmic Moth."

customize.name: Ann
customize.desc: An Oceanid created by the consciousness of Mary-Ann.

customize.name: Seymour
customize.desc: Prototype 4ACV07 is a mechanical dog created by Alain Guillotin to protect his sister Mary-Ann Guillotin during her service in the Marechaussee Phantom.

customize.name: Mary-Ann
customize.desc: An Oceanid living in Annapausis. She is a hybrid consciousness Oceanid formed by the merging of Lyris and Mary-Ann Guillotin.

customize.name: Sigewinne
customize.desc: A Melusine and the Fortress of Meropide's head nurse. She cares equally for every convict locked in the undersea prison.

customize.name: Golden Troupe
customize.desc: A flower constructed out of clam, mother-of-pearl, and gold leaf. It blooms proudly.

customize.name: Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc:
A holy sword that bears a special meaning in a certain story.

It belongs to no one.

customize.text: Fort Charybdis Ruins

<color=#ffffffd9>"Unlike the barbarians or the witless creatures of the waters,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>All our strength comes from our will.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Our will is that which we share with the noblest gods,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Just as flesh is what we have in common with the barbarous beasts.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Those who can truly use this wisdom,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>May be able to forsake the bonds of flesh,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And when they use their will to command, the rest shall bow down and listen."</color>

Fort Charybdis was located on an island to the right of Mont Automnequi and more than a thousand years ago served as a military fort for the legions of the God King Remus, ruler of Remuria. After the fall of Remuria, the fort fell into ruins. The Orthant of Wishes is located in the underground caves.
Official archaeological work on the construction of the Orthant took place under the approval of the Palais Mermonia, with the Marechaussee Hunters in charge of security. At that time, the organization had not yet been declared radical, and it hid its true plans. During construction, disagreements began between members of the order: rumors arose that the leader of the Ordo, Narzissenkreuz, had died.

When members approached Jakob Ingold, he replied that Narzissenkreuz was conducting a "great ritual" associated with the celestial bodies and primordial fire. According to him, Narzissenkreuz required supreme concentration and isolation from the outside world. In fact, the rumors were true, and Narzissenkreuz actually died trying to be reborn from Rene de Petrichor into a more powerful being. Jakob spent many months researching, trying to revive his friend with the help of the Holy Blade, the Oceanid Lyris's abilities, and a pocket watch given to them by their mutual friend, Alain Guillotin. Later, during the experiments, Jakob and Narzissenkreuz transferred part of the consciousness of their other perished friend, Carter Scherbius, into the body of a hilichurl, and thus Caterpillar was born.
When Caterpillar, Ann, Seymour, the Traveler, and Paimon went to Orthant of Wishes, they again saw a sign with a riddle at the entrance.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Lo, this place is the Orthant of Wishes, the Temple of Wishes, the Room of Wishes..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Often contradicting"... "Born in an instant, your company in eternal rest, never separated"... "The tainted fruits of sin"...</color>

All Fontainians were considered by ancient prophecy to be "sinners," whose lives were "tainted with original sin," so the answer to the riddle turned out to be "life." As in the Orthant of Souls, the Traveler did not discover the substance to create the Holy Blade of Reason, since Jakob Ingold beat them to it.

To the northwest of Fort Charybdis, there is a small island, underground of which there is the third point from the Circle of Orthants, the Orthant of Memory ‚Äî the Hall of Memory, the Room of Memory. Its entrance was again blocked by a riddle: <color=#ffffffd9>"Born in an instant"... "Often contradicting, your company in eternal rest, never separated"... "Fire cannot burn it"...</color> The instant a beam of light shines, a shadow is born, so the answer was "shadow." Although the Traveler solved the riddle, the substance could not be found in the Orthant. In the caves under Fort Charybdis Ruins, there are two mysterious-looking glasses-portals.

<color=#ffffffd9>"If water loses its incisiveness, how shall it become water again?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>If a tree leaves the soil, where shall it go to take root?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>No matter how mightily stone may strike upon metal,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Humans cannot survive without water or soil."</color>

In another passage of the cave where the Orthant of Memory was built, the laboratory of Dr. Mosso is located. Dr. Mosso was a scientist who created the intelligent lie detector, "Curve," and died in a legal duel defending his invention 30 years ago. In the same laboratory, Curve sacrificed himself, saving his friends, Melusine Talochard, the Traveler, and Paimon.

To the left of the island where Fort Charybdis is located, underwater, there was the secret hideout of researcher Nacker. Nacker stole an Arkhium Kinetic Core from the ruins of the Fontaine Research Institute's Central Laboratory and escaped with it. The researcher wanted to synchronize the field generator created by researcher Edwin Eastinghouse and the kinetic core, in hopes of becoming the greatest kinetic engineer of all time. A special investigator from the Institute, Fusilier, was sent to investigate Nacker's disappearance along with the core. Thanks to her investigation, Nacker was found and sent to the Fortress of Meropide by court order.

One day in Mondstadt, the Traveler and Paimon met a Sumeru merchant, Jala, who unknowingly released Sumeru anglers into Cider Lake. Thanks to the actions of the Knights of the Favonius, all the anglers' nests were destroyed, and after paying a hefty fine, Jala was released. After the incident in Mondstadt, the woman decided to fight against the spread of invasive fish species and became the Unchained Hunter. Naive people believe that before doing something important, you should release some animals into the wild. It will bring you good fortune. Some even started buying animals just to release them. This opinion quickly spread throughout Teyvat, and people who adhered to it began to call themselves "The Unchained." Some specifically bought fish for this purpose, and merchants realized that they could make a profit from it. They started smuggling various animals from all over and used strange feed to make them look more beautiful, before selling them off to members of The Unchained at exorbitant prices. One of Jala's cases involved a criminal who had released invasive fish into Fontaine waters on the east coast of the Fort Charybdis Ruins. With the help of Jala and the Traveler, officer of the Maison Gardiennage, Enghiene, who had already met with the Traveler in the Lil' Fungi's Fun-Tastic Fiesta and in the Swordmaster case, found the criminal who was threatening the safety of Fontaine's ecosystem and the quality of the famous Fonta.
In this subarea, the world quests
and

can be found.

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo
customize.desc: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo is the secret society formed by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold to create Neohumans in order to survive against the destruction of the world as foretold by the world-formula. It was declared an illegal extremist group and a criminal organization by Fontainian law under Iudex Neuvillette.

customize.name: Fontaine Research Institute
customize.desc: The Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering was founded by Alain Guillotin and is often shortened to simply the Fontaine Research Institute.

customize.name: Knights of Favonius
customize.desc: An order responsible for protecting Mondstadt and its belief of freedom. Despite its members are known as knights, none have been knighted by any royalty ‚Äî knighthood is a title they earned from the noble duties they assume.

customize.name: Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc: The leader of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, formerly known as Rene de Petrichor.

customize.name: Jakob
customize.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

customize.name: Alain Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted son of Emanuel Guillotin, who was raised at the Narzissenkreuz Institute with his adoptive sister, Mary-Ann. He is the founder of the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering, with his most notable contribution to Fontaine being his research in Pneuma-Ousia, which led to the invention of the Arkhe system and the creation of Clockwork Meka.

customize.name: Caterpillar
customize.desc: A member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo given the title "Chrysalis of the Phantasmic Moth."

customize.name: Talochard
customize.desc: An evidence clerk in the Marechaussee Phantom.

customize.name: "Curve"
customize.desc: A lie detector created by Dr. Mosso thirty years ago.

customize.name: Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc:
A holy sword that bears a special meaning in a certain story.

It belongs to no one.

customize.text: Tower of Ipsissimus

In the center of the Morte Region stood the abandoned Tower of
once owned by the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. When Alain Guillotin learned about the organization's experiments, he, together with the Iudex of Fontaine, Neuvillette, issued a decree banning the order. After this, the Tower of Gestalt was sealed.

The Tower of Ipsissimus originated from an old concept from the ancient Fontainian kingdom of Remuria and was used to describe a powerful will that could rule, sustain, and destroy the world. This tower was designed by the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and represented the evolution of the human soul and the infinite mysteries of the world. The Narzissenkreuz Ordo believed that people continuously refine themselves through samsara cycles. These included Hyperborea, Natlantean, Remuria, and the first half of the
which humanity was presently experiencing.

The Tower of Gestalt was the main component of the "Seal of Chymical Marriage" and was built in the center of the Circle of Four Orthants. This tower was supposed to be a key element for controlling the people's wills with the help of the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz and Lyris's abilities. The order's plans were not destined to come true ‚Äî the organization ceased to exist, its leader, Narzissenkreuz, was sealed in the Primordial Sea under the tower, and only Jakob Ingold remained to wait for the return of his friend and the onset of a new world.

<color=#ffffffd9>"O Remus, player of the grand symphony, king of all the world.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Your music is heard across the heavens! It resounds throughout the earth.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>When Sybilla's Golden Bee gives you a warning,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>O Merciful One, grant us eternal life.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Proclaim this sacred moment,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>That it should be praised for all eternity."</color>

In the south of the subarea, the last of the Orthants, the Orthant of Persona, is built. All the points where the Orthants were built were found using changes in the water composition. At the right points, the water contained the water of the Primordial Sea. This Orthant was the only one sealed, and there was the inscription on the tablet: <color=#ffffffd9>"Always united"... "Born in an instant, often contradicting, I accompany you in eternal rest"... "the first droplet."</color>

There's a legend that says that Oceanids came from the first tear shed by the first Hydro Archon, Egeria. Meanwhile, the first tear on the earth was shed by the first Oceanid after she came to understand humanity. Ann solved the riddle, and the answer was "Oceanid." This Orthant contained the final component for the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz, the "Persona" element. As soon as the Traveler took the substance, they and the others fell into Jakob's trap and unwittingly ended up in the Tower of Ipsissimus.
In the Orthant of Persona, the mysterious looking glass, which leads to the world inside the Book of Revelation, can be found.

Inside the Tower of Ipsissimus once stood the headquarters of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, which was also accessed by a portal through a book at the Institute of Natural Philosophy, where Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold once worked. On the ceiling of the room, a huge Doomsday clock was set, which counted down the time until the apocalypse predicted by the "world formula." When Caterpillar, Ann, Seymour, the Traveler, and Paimon found themselves in this room, having fallen into Jakob's trap, the clock struck midnight and its hand fell, breaking through the floor and taking Jakob's life with it. He was loyal to the Narzissenkreuz Ordo to the end.

Three special keys were designed for the tower, capable of lowering it underwater and opening a passage to the Primordial Sea. When combined, the keys form a peculiar shape of three and a half circles. The innermost circle is the Cycle of Hyperborea, symbolizing the age when the world was frozen and the lost paradise. The middle circle is the Cycle of Natlantean, symbolizing the triumph over the evil dragon, a metaphor for humanity's victory over nature as well as the beasts within themselves. The third circle and outermost half circle are the Cycles of Remuria and Khraun-Arya, symbolizing the relationship between humans and gods. The human spirit undergoes the loss of paradise, the defeat of evil dragons, the original sin and baptism, and finally, freedom from the gods.

When rumors spread in the order about the death of Narzissenkreuz, divinations of a formal member of the order, Madam M. Laveaux, showed that he was in the Tower of Ipsissimus. This did not convince some members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, and they decided to leave the organization, losing faith in the future. When others divined their location, it turned out that all the members who had left the order were still in the tower. All of them were dissolved by the Primordial Water for the sake of the revival of Narzissenkreuz.

In the Primordial Sea under the tower, reborn Narzissenkreuz had been residing for all these years. After his rebirth, he did not remember the failure, so he believed that the experiment to get rid of the shackles of the physical body was successful. <color=#ffffffd9>"Everything has become consummately clear. All meaningless obstacles have vanished."</color> He acquired a new body and sent Jakob, Lyris, and Caterpillar into the petrified body of a creature from the Abyss, while he remained in the Primordial Sea to await the fulfillment of the prophecy and the beginning of the apocalypse.

On one of the levels of the tower, there is the last mysterious looking glass leading to the Book of Revelations.
Throughout the Morte Region, mechanisms created by the researcher and one of the sponsors of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, Eliphas, are built. His inventions include the Eliphas Beam, the Vertical Lifting Column, the Track Assemblage, and the Tower of Ipsissimus's Optical Couplers. Eliphas became one of the members of the order, dissolved by the waters of the Primordial Sea, for the sake of a common goal.

Before the sinking of the Tower of Gestalt, Melusine Nadia and Urville tried to find the treasures of the secret society, the "Liliacruces Forum." When the tower sank underwater, they ended up in the water, and Urville faced his main enemies ‚Äî the ball octopuses. Thanks to the help of the Traveler, Urville was saved. It turned out that he was trying to find treasure to help cure Nadia, who was suffering from amnesia caused by a traumatic brain injury. Although the treasure turned out to be fiction, Urville decided to find other ways to make money.
In the water near the Tower of Gestalt, treasure maps left by the Treasure Hoarder Rouge and his friends are located. Two such treasures can be found in the Fort Charybdis ruins.
In this subarea, the world quests
, and

can be found.

customize.name: Oceanids
customize.desc: Oceanids are intelligent Hydro lifeforms created by the previous Hydro Archon, Egeria, and are able to manipulate water at will. All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.name: Urville

customize.name: Ball Octopus
customize.desc:
An aquatic creature that hunts by firing watery projectiles.

The ability to fire water bombs is of course not uncommon among Fontemer Aberrants. But for your average careless diver, most of whom are tourists, a high-pressure water current of this kind can pose a significant threat. The thickness of diving equipment is therefore necessary for two reasons ‚Äì firstly, to resist the pressure of the water itself, but secondly, to protect against the attacks of Fontemer Aberrants.

The third circle and outermost half circle are the Cycles of Remuria and Khraun-Arya, symbolizing the relationship between humans and gods.
